article: I was born in the Great Depression to a carpenter father and a home keeping mother.Our family had a large garden, raised two pigs for their meat, and had a cow for her milk.When Dad _ his work, we started a laundry in our home.This _ up to seven girls at one time.Dad also rented 12 acres of nearby land to _ a few extra dollars. I was _ to have good teachers to help in my learning.Following graduation, I spent two years in the army, _ me to see Europe and build on my experiences.Then I returned home, got a job in the local _ and married my sweetheart.I was on my way to a _ lifestyle, but I was called back into the army when they built the Berlin Wall.Tha turned out to be a blessing too.As I hadn't worked _ enough at the bank to begin health insurance , our oldest son, Ken, was born in an army hospital, which _ only $ 8.25.  Following a year at Fort Chaffee, Arkansas, I _ home to work at the bank again.I worked my _ up through the ranks to become Chairman, President, and the CEO of the bank _ retiring in 1997.I was blessed to have had good employers and employees.I've been blessed to have a _ wife and wonderful children and grandchildren.I'm _ thankful to all I've met along the way. Today, I look back on those grand _ and see they were my possibilities to grow.I _ many opportunities.They taught me to _ for a rainy day.They taught me to _ those less fortunate than me.They taught me to put others first, _ I wanted to be successful in life.
